From 1996 to 2000 microclimatic conditions (profiles of wind-speed, temperature, humidity and radiation) have been investigated to determine the energy balance within a primary Amazonian rainforest in southern Venezuela (Surumoni crane project), located on the banks of the upper Rio Orinoco.

the five major tropical rainforest regions (tropical America, Africa, Southeast Asia, Madagascar and New Guinea) are distinct ecological and biogeographical entities

Tropical montane cloud forests (TMCF) differ from lowland moist forests in structure (low stature, small and tough leaves, low diversity) and functioning (low productivity, low nutrient‐cycling rates).

This manuscript presents a Google Earth Engine (GEE)-managed pipeline to compute the annual status of Brazilian mangroves from 1985 to 2018, along with a new spectral index, the Modular Mangrove Recognition Index (MMRI), which has been specifically designed to better discriminate mangrove forests from the surrounding vegetation.
